item.title: 降价、支出减少或将增强美联储对通胀前景的信心
item.description: 美国主要零售商的新一轮降价以及显示消费者支出放缓的数据，可能会增强美联储对通胀下降的信心，并使自 COVID-19 大流行开始以来在国民收入中占据较大份额的企业利润不再那么吃香。【原文：A new round of price cuts by major U.S. retailers and data showing a consumer spending slowdown may boost the Federal Reserve's confidence in falling inflation and take the edge off of corporate profits that have grabbed a larger share of national income since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 美国 PCE 对紧张市场的考验
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，比尔-阿克曼正计划对潘兴广场进行 IPO
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五报道，对冲基金亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）正计划最快于明年为其投资公司潘兴广场资本管理公司（Pershing Square Capital Management）进行首次公开募股。【原文：Hedge fund billionaire Bill Ackman is planning an initial public offering for his investment firm Pershing Square Capital Management as soon as next year, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday.】

item.title: 前总统唐纳德-特朗普被判刑后，特朗普媒体下滑
item.description: 在陪审团认定美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普在 2016 年大选前伪造文件以掩盖向一名色情明星支付封口费的罪名成立后，特朗普传媒与科技集团（Trump Media & Technology Group）的股价在周五的盘前交易中下跌了 8%。【原文：Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group dropped 8% in premarket trading on Friday after a jury found former U.S. president Donald Trump guilty of falsifying documents to cover up a payment to silence a porn star ahead of the 2016 election.】

item.title: 特斯拉因安全带警告系统召回超过12.5万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，由于安全带预警系统出现故障，特斯拉将在美国召回125227辆汽车。【原文：Tesla is recalling 125,227 vehicles in the U.S. due to a malfunction in its seat belt warning system, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 全球首席执行官薪酬之争
item.description: 特斯拉股东将于 6 月 13 日就首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案进行投票，特拉华州法官在 1 月份宣布该方案无效，称其金额 "深不可测"，因为她发现这位亿万富翁不当控制了这一过程。【原文：Tesla shareholders will vote on CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package on June 13 that a Delaware judge voided in January, calling the sum "unfathomable" and because she found the billionaire improperly controlled the process.】

item.title: 消息人士称，空中客车公司在零部件短缺的情况下面临新的产量压力
item.description: 业内消息人士周四称，由于零部件和劳动力短缺，空中客车公司近期客机增产面临新的压力。【原文：Airbus is facing new pressure on its near-term production ramp-up for passenger jets due to parts and labour shortages, industry sources said on Thursday.】

item.title: 由于供应不足，主要经济体的经济适用房仍将遥不可及
item.description: 路透社对房地产分析师进行的一项民意调查显示，面临住房危机的主要经济体在未来几年内将很难增加经济适用房的供应量。【原文：Major economies grappling with housing crises will struggle to crank up the supply of affordable homes in coming years, according to a Reuters poll of property analysts who said more government intervention was needed to improve the situation.】

item.title: 美国银行称，投资者连续流入企业债券的时间为 2019 年以来最长
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America）周五表示，截至本周三的一周内，全球投资者向投资级公司债券基金投入了 36 亿美元，这是连续第 31 周资金流入，也是 2019 年以来最长的连续流入周。【原文：Global investors poured $3.6 billion into investment grade corporate bond funds in the week to Wednesday, Bank of America said on Friday, in the 31st straight week of inflows, the longest streak since 2019.】

item.title: 加密货币 "再盯盘 "平台蓬勃发展，交易者追逐更高回报
item.description: 价值超过 180 亿美元的加密货币已经转移到一个新型平台，该平台为投资者提供奖励，以换取他们锁定代币，分析师警告说，这种复杂的计划会给用户和加密货币市场带来风险。【原文：More than $18 billion worth of cryptocurrency has moved into a new type of platform which offers investors rewards in exchange for locking up their tokens, in a complex scheme that analysts warn poses a risk for users and the crypto market.】

item.title: 修复被战争毁坏的工厂后，Mondelez 恢复在乌克兰生产奥利奥饼干
item.description: 大约两年前，位于乌克兰东部一个小城市的工厂在俄罗斯入侵期间遭到严重破坏，此后，零食制造商梦迪尔兹公司恢复了在乌克兰的奥利奥饼干生产。【原文：Snack maker Mondelez resumed its production of Oreo cookies in Ukraine, after its plant in a small city in the eastern part of the country was badly damaged during Russia's invasion roughly two years ago.】

item.title: 日本央行专家呼吁稳步加息，警告通胀风险
item.description: 了解日本货币政策的学者 Takeo Hoshi 说，日本央行必须稳步提高利率，以防范通胀加速远高于 2% 目标的风险。【原文：The Bank of Japan must steadily raise interest rates to guard against the risk of inflation accelerating well above its 2% target, said Takeo Hoshi, an academic with knowledge of the country's monetary policy.】

item.title: 日本家庭支出 14 个月来首次出现增长：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，日本家庭支出有望实现14个月来的首次同比增长，尽管增长乏力可能会凸显消费领域的持续疲软。【原文：Japan is expected to post its first year-on-year rise in household spending in 14 months, a Reuters poll showed on Friday, although the tepid growth is likely to highlight persistent weakness in the consumer sector.】

item.title: 美国收益率 "令人不安 "地反弹，给屡创新高的股市蒙上阴影
item.description: 国债收益率再次上升，对美国股市的反弹构成了潜在的障碍，而美国股市的反弹已将主要股指推向历史新高。【原文：Treasury yields are on the rise again, presenting a potential obstacle to a U.S. stock rally that has taken major indexes to record highs.】

item.title: 雷诺与吉利成立混合动力和内燃机合资企业
item.description: 法国汽车制造商雷诺和中国合作伙伴吉利周五宣布成立一家备受期待的合资企业，该企业将开发内燃机和混合动力发动机，旨在提高双方传统汽车业务的竞争力。【原文：French automaker Renault and Chinese partner Geely announced a highly anticipated joint venture on Friday that will develop combustion and hybrid engines, aiming to improve the competitiveness of their legacy auto business.】

item.title: 欧洲 投资者对通胀数据屏息以待
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 飞机短缺变为一些航空公司的现金红利
item.description: 飞机短缺正在变成一些航空公司的赚钱工具，因为供应短缺使航空公司能够以比他们支付的价格高得多的价格向租赁公司出售新飞机。【原文：Aircraft shortages are turning into a moneymaker for some airlines as the dearth of supply allows carriers to sell new planes to leasing companies at much higher prices than they paid.】

item.title: 亚洲股市上涨，美元漂移，通胀考验仍在等待
item.description: 亚洲股市周五上涨，有望实现连续第四个月上涨，而美元走低，使日元保持稳定，因为投资者正在等待欧洲和美国的通胀数据，这些数据可能将决定全球利率的走向。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Friday and were poised for the fourth month of gains, while the dollar drifted lower, keeping the yen steady as investors await inflation readings from Europe and the U.S. that will likely dictate the path of interest rates globally.】

item.title: 全球航空公司老板应对地缘政治和气候挑战
item.description: 在下周举行的年度峰会上，地缘政治紧张局势、飞机短缺和雄心勃勃的环保目标将给全球航空公司的老板们带来一系列挑战，票价疲软使航空公司的前景更加微妙。【原文：Geopolitical tensions, aircraft shortages and ambitious environmental targets will deliver a host of challenges to global airline bosses at an annual summit next week, with softening fares completing a delicate outlook for carriers.】

item.title: ISS 建议投票反对特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 2018 年薪酬计划
item.description: 机构股东服务公司（Institutional Shareholder Services）建议投资者在这家电动汽车制造商 6 月 13 日的年会上投票反对批准特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的薪酬计划，称奖励价值 "过大"。【原文：Institutional Shareholder Services recommended investors vote against ratifying the pay plan of Tesla CEO Elon Musk at the electric carmaker's June 13 annual meeting, calling the award value "outsized."】

item.title: 波音消防员批准新合同协议
item.description: 波音公司消防员周四投票通过了一项为期四年的新合同协议，该协议将提高工人工资，并结束该飞机制造商长达数周的停工。【原文：Boeing firefighters voted on Thursday to approve a new four-year contract deal that will boost wages for workers and end a weeks-long lockout by the planemaker.】

item.title: 中国 5 月份工厂活动意外萎缩
item.description: 周五，一项官方工厂调查显示，中国制造业活动在 5 月份意外下滑，由于长期的房地产危机继续对企业、消费者和投资者造成压力，要求采取新刺激措施的呼声持续高涨。【原文：China's manufacturing activity unexpectedly fell in May, an official factory survey showed on Friday, keeping alive calls for fresh stimulus as a protracted property crisis continues to weigh on businesses, consumers and investors.】

item.title: 中国五月工厂活动意外萎缩
item.description: 周五，一项官方工厂调查显示，中国制造业活动在 5 月份意外下滑，由于长期的房地产危机继续对企业、消费者和投资者造成压力，要求采取新刺激措施的呼声持续高涨。【原文：China's manufacturing activity unexpectedly fell in May, an official factory survey showed on Friday, keeping alive calls for fresh stimulus as a protracted property crisis continues to weigh on businesses, consumers and investors.】

item.title: 美元在通胀测试前保持稳定；日元受东京 CPI 影响不大
item.description: 美国第一季度国内生产总值（GDP）的下调表明今年仍有降息空间，同时投资者也在为通胀数据做准备，美元兑其他货币在周五舔舐伤口。【原文：The dollar was licking wounds against peer currencies on Friday after a downward revision to U.S. GDP for the first quarter suggested room for rate cuts this year, while investors braced for inflation data.】

item.title: 日元持续疲软，日本数据将确认外汇干预措施
item.description: 日本将于周五公布备受关注的数据，显示日本在 5 月份为支撑日元汇率而干预外汇市场的支出，这些举措使日元汇率没有跌至新低，但不太可能扭转长期跌势。【原文：Japan will release closely watched data on Friday that shows how much it spent intervening in the foreign exchange market to prop up the yen in May, in moves that kept the currency from testing new lows but are unlikely to reverse longer-term declines.】

item.title: 美联储决策者寻求维持降息政策，汽油库存上升，油价下跌
item.description: 周五早盘，油价下跌，原因是投资者对美国联邦储备委员会（Fed）官员的言论做出了回应，他们称现在开始考虑降息还为时过早，而且美国汽油库存意外增加也对市场造成了压力。【原文：Oil prices fell early on Friday as investors responded to comments from U.S. Fed officials who said it was too soon to start considering rate cuts, and following a surprise build in U.S. gasoline stocks that weighed on the market.】

item.title: 通胀数据喜忧参半，产出疲软加剧日本央行加息时机的不确定性
item.description: 周五的数据显示，由于电费上涨，5月份日本首都的核心消费通胀率加速上升，但剔除燃料影响的物价增长有所放缓，这加剧了日本央行下一次加息时间的不确定性。【原文：Core consumer inflation in Japan's capital accelerated in May on rising electricity bills but price growth excluding the effect of fuel eased, data showed on Friday, heightening uncertainty on the timing of the central bank's next interest rate hike.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体股价在唐纳德-特朗普封口费定罪后下跌
item.description: 在纽约一个陪审团判定前总统唐纳德-特朗普在 2016 年大选前伪造文件以掩盖向一名色情明星支付封口费之后，特朗普媒体&科技集团的股价周四尾盘下跌了 6.5%。【原文：Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group dropped 6.5% late on Thursday after a New York jury convicted former President Donald Trump for falsifying documents to cover up a payment to silence a porn star ahead of the 2016 election.】

item.title: 美国诉讼称马斯克无视警告，隐瞒 Twitter 股份
item.description: 一项诉讼称，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）无视有关他在 2022 年不断增加的 Twitter 股份可能引发的美国证券披露义务的多次警告。【原文：Elon Musk ignored repeated warnings about the U.S. securities disclosure obligations potentially triggered by his growing stake in Twitter in 2022, according to a Morgan Stanley executive who helped Musk secretly amass shares in the social media firm, a lawsuit says.】

item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】
